programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: MacArthur Park: After losing countless jobs because of the kids, MacArthur shows up at the school seeking revenge. (S3 Ep5)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Carmageddon: Duncan is rattled when Chef, tired of having his car destroyed, buys a new one that is completely indestructible. (S3 Ep7)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Polar Bear: Nutty Hill is suffering from a heat wave. Searching for a bit of cool air, Grizzy has a brilliant idea. He'll get into the fridge, where the temperature will be more bearable. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Spread: Grizzy is frustrated: just as he was about to coat a nice big fresh salmon with chocolate spread and snuggle up in front of the TV, he discovers that the pantry is empty! (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Cellular Bear: Grizzy's nap is interrupted by the forest ranger's cell phone. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Jurassic Bear: Freed by the thawing ice, a giant egg slides up to the front door of the cabin. The lemmings watch the hatching of a baby dinosaur that soon thinks they are its parents. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Extreme Fitness: In order to woo the she-bear he's infatuated with, Grizzy decides to take things in hand and get into shape with the ranger's bodybuilding equipment. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Domestic Robots: Grizzy discovers that the ranger's new robot vacuum cleaner also gives very pleasant back massages, but the lemmings see the new gadget more as competition... (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Mass Control: While searching for the television remote control, Grizzy discovers a gadget that controls various functions in the cabin. (S1 Ep7)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Under Control: To make sure that the lemmings don't snatch his chocolate spread while he's taking his nap, Grizzy turns the fridge into a safe - combination lock and all. (S1 Ep8)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Popcorn Party: The lemmings have invented a new popcorn game. When Grizzy notices that his she-bear seems to be drawn by the smell, he invites her over for a snack, just the two of them. (S1 Ep9)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Dancing with the Bears: Grizzy wants to learn to dance the mambo to please the she-bear he's in love with. (S1 Ep10)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Role Change: After receiving a terrible blow over the head, Grizzy is no longer the same: he thinks he's a rodent! (S1 Ep11)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Lemming Tonic: Grizzy is exhausted and the couch has never seemed so enticing! He goes to fetch a pillow and a sleeping mask, but the lemmings have entirely different plans for the couch. (S1 Ep12)

programme.title: Margery and Gladys
programme.desc: 2003. Comedy/Drama. Director: Geoffrey Sax. Stars Penelope Keith, June Brown & Alan David. A wealthy housewife and her maid go on the run after attacking a house burglar and leaving him for dead. [S]

programme.title: Black Velvet Band
programme.desc: 1997. Drama. Director: Robert Knights. Stars Nick Berry, Todd Carty & Chris McHallem. A failed attempt to steal the crown jewels lands a band of crooks on a ship to Australia, but can they escape? [S]

programme.title: Della
programme.desc: 1964. Directed by Robert Gist and starring Joan Crawford. Della (Crawford), a reclusive, wealthy matriarch of Royal Bay, watches over the affluent coastal town. Possession, for her, is everything. [S]

programme.title: Out of Town
programme.desc: Pannage/Dry Fly Fishing on the River Test. 1981. Jack Hargreaves watches woodland pigs foraging for acorns at pannage time. He then continues his album of dry fly fishing on the River Test. [S]

programme.title: A Hole Lot of Trouble
programme.desc: Directed by Francis A Searle. A 1969 comedy short centring around workmen digging a hole. Starring Arthur Lowe, Victor Maddern, Bill Maynard and Tim Barrett. [S]

programme.title: Up River
programme.desc: 1979. Drama. Murder, violence and greed haunt a young man's dream of forming a life from the untamed wilds of British Columbia at the turn of the century. [S]

programme.title: What's On TPTV With Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed at the end of May and beginning of June. [S]

programme.title: Goldeneye
programme.desc: 1989. Biography. Director: Don Boyd. Stars Charles Dance, Phyllis Logan & Patrick Ryecart. The story of Ian Fleming and how his work in the intelligence services inspired him to create James Bond. [S]

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: Back to Californy. 1963. Stars Irene Ryan, Buddy Ebsen & Nancy Kulp. The Clampetts are going back to Beverly Hills with Pearl and Jethrine, but Jethrine doesn't want to leave her boyfriend behind. [S]

programme.title: The Big Combo
programme.desc: 1955. Crime. Director: Joseph H. Lewis. Stars Cornel Wilde & Jean Wallace. A police lieutenant, on a mission to bring down an elusive crime boss, targets the gangster's girlfriend to get her help. [S]

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge
programme.desc: The Crowman. 1979. Stars Jon Pertwee, Geoffrey Bayldon & Joan Sims. A lonely Worzel begs his creator, the Crowman, to make him a handsome head so he can get a wife, but will his plan work? [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Green Ice. 1966. Stars Adam West, Otto Preminger & Dee Hartford. Mr. Freeze kidnaps Miss Iceland from the Gotham City Beauty Contest to freeze her to 50 degrees below zero and marry her. [S]

programme.title: Cactus Flower
programme.desc: 1969. Comedy. Directed by Gene Saks. Stars Walter Matthau, Ingrid Bergman & Goldie Hawn. A dentist convinces his assistant to pose as his wife so he can avoid marrying his girlfriend. [S]

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
programme.desc: The Parting Guest. 1960. Stars Richard Greene, Patricia Driscoll & Hugh McDermott. Duncan the Scottish Highlander causes problems when he overstays his welcome and becomes infatuated by Marian. [S]

programme.title: Out of Town
programme.desc: Tidal Mill/Ice Fishing. 1986. After visiting Ely Mill, Jack recounts the story of his unwise attempt to win a bet by catching fish on a frozen Kent river in mid-Winter. [S]

programme.title: The Footage Detectives
programme.desc: We head to the English Riviera in the 40s, there's an incredible lost reel of The Tufty Club, we're off to 1940s Islington for tips on staying safe on the roads and do you remember Bile Beans? [S]

programme.title: The Black Tent
programme.desc: 1956. Drama. Directed by Brian Desmond Hurst. Stars Donald Sinden, Anna-Maria Sandri & Anthony Steel. After the war, a young man sets out in search of his missing older brother. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life In Gear
programme.desc: 1967. A magnificent look at the 'in' scene of London, with a focus on the fashions of today and all the different shops where you can buy trendy clothes.

programme.title: Gideon's Way
programme.desc: Morna. Stars John Gregson, Alexander Davion and Daphne Anderson. After a beautiful blonde is found murdered her story is unravelled in flashbacks about her relationship to her posh school friends. [S]

programme.title: The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club
programme.desc: Episode 27. 1975. Sheila Southern performs 'Sing', and Terry Lightfoot and his band perform four numbers. Pat Mooney, Wee Willie Harris and Stu Francis also feature. [S]

programme.title: Jigsaw
programme.desc: 1962. Directed by Val Guest and starring Jack Warner. A woman is murdered and it's up to Detective Fellows to sift through the clues and solve the 'Jigsaw'. Great shots of Brighton in the 60s. [S]

programme.title: Budgie
programme.desc: Louie The Ring is Dead. Stars: Adam Faith, Iain Cuthbertson & Lynn Dalby. Budgie meets his old flame Hazel and decides that it is time to make some quick money. [S]

programme.title: Budgie
programme.desc: Louie The Ring is Dead. Stars: Adam Faith, Iain Cuthbertson & Lynn Dalby. Budgie meets his old flame Hazel and decides that it is time to make some quick money. [S]

programme.title: The Heritage Chart Show with Mike Read
programme.desc: A TOTP style TV Show for Heritage Artists based on the Heritage Chart which is voted on in over 80 countries. Songs you love from popular artists, live and on video with the odd interview.

programme.title: The Facts of Life
programme.desc: 1961. Comedy. Directed by Melvin Frank. Stars Bob Hope, Lucille Ball & Ruth Hussey. When their spouses drop out of their holiday, Larry and Kitty must prepare for the worst: each other's company. [S]

programme.title: Star Performance
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Director: Robert Florey. Stars Ronald Colman, Elisabeth Fraser & Hillary Brooke. Whilst listening to his patients, a respected psychiatrist imagines himself within each of their stories.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Reunion. 1959. Stars Rory Calhoun, Robert F. Simon & Richard Carlyle. After the surrender at Appomattox, Longley and two of his junior officers agree to reunite five years later. [S]

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: Think Quicker, Vicar. 1964. Stars David Kossoff, Hazel Coppen & David Stoll. Lofty reveals the vicar's wife has left him and Ada takes a team of odd jobbers to keep an eye on his new housekeeper. [S]

programme.title: Juggernaut (1936)
programme.desc: 1936. Mystery. Director: Henry Edwards. Stars Boris Karloff, Joan Wyndham & Mona Goya. An evil doctor and the greedy wife of a rich man plot to poison him so they can get their hands on his money. [S]

programme.title: The Large Rope
programme.desc: (AKA: The Long Rope). 1953. Drama. Director: Wolf Rilla. Stars Donald Houston, Susan Shaw & Peter Byrne. A man returns to where he was accused of murdering a girl to prove his innocence. [S]

programme.title: Women Without Men
programme.desc: 1956. Drama. Directors: Elmo Williams & Bert Glazer. Stars Beverly Michaels & Joan Rice. Angie plans to meet her boyfriend on New Years Eve but winds up in jail. Can she find a way to get to him? [S]

programme.title: Star Performance: The Book
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Roy Kellino. Stars David Niven, Marguerite Chapman & Douglas Fowley. An author's curiosity about a piece of paper found in a library book leads him to a group of spies.

programme.title: Clash By Night
programme.desc: 1963. Drama. Directed by Montgomery Tully. Starring Terence Longdon, Jennifer Jayne & Harry Fowler. A prison bus enroute to jail is hijacked by a gang determined to free their leader. [S]

programme.title: Someone at the Door
programme.desc: 1950. Crime. Director: Francis Searle. Stars Michael Medwin, Garry Marsh, Hugh Latimer. Ronnie and Sally discover that a secret passage in their new home is also a storeroom for a gang of thieves. [S]

programme.title: The Durant Affair
programme.desc: 1962. Drama. Directed by Godfrey Grayson. Stars Jane Griffiths, Conrad Phillips. When a wealthy society hostess dies, the search begins for the rightful heir, unveiling an unexpected heiress. [S]

programme.title: The Dark Road
programme.desc: 1948. Drama. Directed by Alfred J. Goulding. Stars Farnham Baxter, Cyril Chamberlain & Sydney Bromley. The story of Sidney Robertson and his rise from a petty thief to an underworld crime boss. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life There Ought To Be a Law
programme.desc: 1968. With Sam Kydd. A light-hearted look at some of the laws you never even thought existed, and their pitfalls.

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: The Girl From Home. 1964. Buddy Ebsen, Peter Whitney & Muriel Landers. Lafe Crick arrives with his daughter Essiebelle, a beauty contest winner, with a plan to get her and Jethro together. [S]

programme.title: Scotland Yard
programme.desc: 1956. The Case of the River Morgue. Directed by Montgomery Tully. Starring Hugh Moxey, Gordon Needham and Jane Welsh. The police are summoned when a dead body is stolen. (S1, E16)

programme.title: Dixon of Dock Green
programme.desc: Legacy. 1976. Stars Tom Adams, Patrick Jordan & Carlos Douglas. After years in prison, Jack Montelbetti is released. He returns home, only to find the body of a jewel thief in his flat. [S]

programme.title: Out of Town
programme.desc: Tidal Mill/Ice Fishing. 1986. After visiting Ely Mill, Jack recounts the story of his unwise attempt to win a bet by catching fish on a frozen Kent river in mid-Winter. [S]

programme.title: The Footage Detectives
programme.desc: We head back to class with a look at 60s school life, we have reels from the 40s on the dangers of fires in the bedroom, a thirst quenching film about orange juice and who remembers Puffkins? [S]

programme.title: Public Eye
programme.desc: 1973. Mystery Drama. It's a Woman's Privilege. Stars Alfred Burke, Pauline Delaney & Ray Smith. A pleasant visit from Marker's former landlady takes a turn when she tells Marker her problem. [S]

programme.title: Ship of Fools
programme.desc: 1965. Drama. Directed by Stanley Kramer. Stars Vivien Leigh & Simone Signoret. An eclectic group of passenger's board a ship bound for pre-war Germany, forming a microcosm of 1930s society. [S]
